page.title: 02 Kinver Edge.
page.content: National Trust,Hereford & Worcs & Staffs Co Councils. Formation winds blew waves of sand ac- ross a desert surface Beds of sand built up in criss-cross pattern(see rock faces)(on lower Edge) Bunter pebble beds formed over this resisted erosion.Pebbles still visible on pathways.Still signs of fossils. East slope 120m to 60m on W.Sandstone changes to soft sand. Ground reseeded to hold down soil in places. Gorse cut back to control it. Heather pruned for lowflowering.Some ground cleared for night-jar nesting. Adders. Trees-red oak,Cypress oak,African acacia planted,silver birch,black poplar,beech self colonising. Conifers to screen car park but policy not to plant any more conifers.
